critique: This document is a short executive order that waives civil service rules to appoint Mrs. Adelle B. Freeman as a junior bacteriologist in the Department of Agriculture. The rationale is that she is the widow of a government employee who died in the line of duty and she has a relevant degree. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power implications, federalism concerns, national security vs. civil liberties issues, economic regulation aspects, or social inclusion considerations. The order seems primarily motivated by compassionate circumstances and a desire to support the widow of a fallen employee.
